data.title: Manhunt on ITV: Viewers praise ‘brilliant casting’ of Martin Clunes
data.meta_description: MANHUNT aired its second episode this evening as Detective Chief Inspector Colin Sutton set about tracking down the killer behind the heinous crimes.
data.text:
Manhunt: Martin Clunes stars in true story crime drama

DCI Sutton (played by Martin Clunes) uncovered that Levi Bellfield (Celyn Jones) could be linked to three murders.

Viewers were captivated by the ITV drama, which is based on the real life case of Bellfield who murdered Milly Dowler, Marsha McDonnell and Amélie Delagrange.

But those watching at home were quick to praise Martin Clunes for his portrayal of the Chief Inspector and took to social media to praise him.

“#Manhunt. Thank heavens for a realistic portrayal of the police and their work. Great casting. Martin Clunes is always good,” one tweeted.

He’s a superb actor

Manhunt viewer

Another wrote: “#Manhunt is truly gripping drama and I really rate Martin Clunes in it. Incredibly sad that it’s based on a true story.”

“Martin Clunes has came a long way since his Men Behaving Badly days. He’s a superb actor. #Manhunt,” a third opined.

A fourth exclaimed: “Martin Clunes literally such a good actor! #Manhunt.”

“Martin Clunes proving once again that he is an incredible, traditional, textbook actor. One of the best in the business.

#manhunt #itv,” a fifth shared.

A sixth exclaimed: “#Manhunt gets better and better! Martin Clunes is brilliant casting @ITV.”

Tonight’s episode saw the team uncover a witness statement that led them to Levi Bellfield.

Invalid email

We use your sign-up to provide content in ways you've consented to and to improve our understanding of you. This may include adverts from us and 3rd parties based on our understanding. You can unsubscribe at any time. Read our Privacy Policy

The statement from an ex girlfriend said he was violent, had contempt for women and drove a white van, the vehicle the police were looking for.

The reveal of the illuminating statement was a moment that stood out of viewers as they took to Twitter to comment.

“That statement sent chills down me #Manhunt,” one posted.

A second added: “What a lead the witness statement #ManHunt.”

“#Manhunt I can’t be the only person who had goose bumps when they read out that statement! Brilliant,” a third confessed.

Tomorrow will see the series conclude as Bellfield is tracked down.

However, it won’t be a simple task for the team.

The official synopsis for the episode reads: “Detective Chief Inspector Colin Sutton briefs the team in preparation for Bellfield's arrest, but when they raid his home they can't find him.

“DS Griffiths persuades Bellfield's frightened partner Laura Marsh to reveal that he is hiding in the loft.

“Finally they have Bellfield in custody, but the authorities can only hold him for 72 hours.”

Manhunt concludes tomorrow at 9pm on ITV.
